Package com.example.fire_and_based

Class FirebaseUtil

java.lang.Object
com.example.fire_and_based.FirebaseUtil
public class FirebaseUtil extends Object
This class has all the functions for accessing the necessary data from the firebase or storing the necessary data in the firebase.

    • getAllEventsUserIsNotIn

      public static void getAllEventsUserIsNotIn(com.google.firebase.firestore.FirebaseFirestore db, String userID, FirebaseUtil.getAllEventsCallback callback)

    • getUserInvolvementInEvent

      public static void getUserInvolvementInEvent(com.google.firebase.firestore.FirebaseFirestore db, String userID, String eventID, com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnSuccessListener<String> successListener, com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnFailureListener failureListener)
      Asynchronously checks the user's involvement in the specified event.
      Parameters:
      db - the database reference
      userID - the ID of the user
      eventID - the ID of the event to check the user's involvement
      successListener - listener to be called upon successful determination of user's involvement It receives a string indicating the user's involvement ("Attending", "Organizing", or "Browse")
      failureListener - listener to be called upon failure in determining user's involvement It receives an exception indicating the failure reason

    • addEventToDB

      public static void addEventToDB(com.google.firebase.firestore.FirebaseFirestore db, Event event, com.example.fire_and_based.FirebaseUtil.AddEventCallback callback)
      Adds an event to the Firestore database. If an event with the same ID already exists, it will not be added, and the onEventExists function will be invoked
      Parameters:
      db - The Firestore database instance.
      event - The event to add.
      callback - The callback to handle the different outcomes of the operation.
      See Also:
      • FirebaseUtil.AddEventCallback
      • Event

    • addUserToDB

      public static void addUserToDB(com.google.firebase.firestore.FirebaseFirestore db, User user, com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnSuccessListener<Void> successListener, com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnFailureListener failureListener)
      Add a user to the database
      Parameters:
      db - the database
      user - the user
      successListener - what to do in case of success
      failureListener - what to do in case of failure (database error)

      Update an event with the same QR Code
      Parameters:

      Parameters:

    • getEventByPosterQR

      public static void getEventByPosterQR(com.google.firebase.firestore.FirebaseFirestore db, String QRCode, com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnSuccessListener<Event> successListener, com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnFailureListener failureListener)
      Asynchronously retrieves an event based on the provided poster QR code.
      Parameters:
      db - the database reference
      QRCode - the poster QR code to search for
      successListener - listener to be called upon successful retrieval of the event It receives the event object
      failureListener - listener to be called upon failure in retrieving the event It receives an exception indicating the failure reason

    • addEventAndAttendee

      public static void addEventAndAttendee(com.google.firebase.firestore.FirebaseFirestore db, String eventId, String attendee, com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnSuccessListener<Void> successListener, com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnFailureListener failureListener)
      Adds the eventID to the user's attended events field, and the attendee ID to the event's attendees field. Both succeed or fail simultaneously
      Parameters:
      db - the database reference
      eventId - the event ID to add and be added to
      attendee - the user ID to add and be added to

    • addEventAndOrganizer

      public static void addEventAndOrganizer(com.google.firebase.firestore.FirebaseFirestore db, String eventId, String organizer, com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnSuccessListener<Void> successListener, com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnFailureListener failureListener)
      Adds the eventID to the user's organized events field, and the attendee ID to the event's organizers field. Both succeed or fail simultaneously
      Parameters:
      db - the database reference
      eventId - the event ID to add and be added to
      organizer - the user ID to add and be added to

      Adds the eventID to the user's checked in events field and vice versa, or increment both values Both succeed or fail simultaneously

      public static void saveAnnouncement(com.google.firebase.firestore.FirebaseFirestore db, String eventID, Announcement announcement, com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnSuccessListener<Void> successListener, com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnFailureListener failureListener)
      Parameters:
      db - db reference
      eventID - id of event
      announcement - announcement to add

      failureListener - db error

    • sendCoordinatesToEvent

      public static void sendCoordinatesToEvent(com.google.firebase.firestore.FirebaseFirestore db, Event event, com.google.firebase.firestore.GeoPoint geoPoint, com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnSuccessListener<Void> successListener, com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnFailureListener failureListener)
      Sends the user's coordinates to the event's check-in locations.
      Parameters:
      db - The instance of FirebaseFirestore.
      event - The event object to which the user is checking in.
      geoPoint - The GeoPoint object containing the user's coordinates.
      successListener - Listener to be invoked when the operation is successful.
      failureListener - Listener to be invoked when the operation fails.

    • getEventCheckInLocations

      public static void getEventCheckInLocations(com.google.firebase.firestore.FirebaseFirestore db, Event event, com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnSuccessListener<List<com.google.firebase.firestore.GeoPoint>> successListener, com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnFailureListener failureListener)
      Retrieves the check-in locations for a specific event.
      Parameters:
      db - The instance of FirebaseFirestore.
      event - The event object for which check-in locations are to be retrieved.
      successListener - Listener to be invoked with the list of check-in locations when the operation is successful.
      failureListener - Listener to be invoked when the operation fails.

    • removeUserFromEvent

      public static void removeUserFromEvent(com.google.firebase.firestore.FirebaseFirestore db, User user, Event event, com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnSuccessListener<Void> successListener, com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnFailureListener failureListener)
      Removes a user from a specific event.
      Parameters:
      db - The instance of FirebaseFirestore.
      user - The user object to be removed from the event.
      event - The event object from which the user is to be removed.
      successListener - Listener to be invoked when the operation is successful.
      failureListener - Listener to be invoked when the operation fails.
